{{actor | image = Conan Stevens.jpeg |name=Mark "Conan" Stevens |played=Gundabad Orc/[[Keeper of the Dungeons]] |film=''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]''
''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]'' |played2= |film2= |imdb=[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1947403/ Profile] }} '''Mark "Conan" Stevens''' portrayed a Gundabad Orc in ''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]'' and in ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]''. In the third film he is credited as [[Keeper of the Dungeons]]. He was originally cast as [[Azog]], Bolg's father, but switched roles during filming.{{webcite|author=MrCere|articleurl=http://www.theonering.net/torwp/2012/04/22/55228-exclusive-hobbits-conan-stevens-chats-with-torn/|articlename=Exclusive: ‘Hobbit’s’ Conan Stevens chats with TORn|dated=22-April-2012|website=TORN|accessed=02-Aug-2012}} After that, he was cast to portray [[Bolg]] in the [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' film trilogy]] through prosthetic makeup but later he was replaced by [[Lawrence Makoare]], who portrayed him through CGI and performance capture in the later film.{{webcite|author=[[Peter Jackson]]|articleurl=http://www.facebook.com/note.php?note_id=10150257180211558|articlename=Casting News for The Hobbit|dated=19-May-2011|website=[http://www.facebook.com/ Facebook]|accessed=22-Dec-2011}} However, Stevens was still credited as Bolg in the ending credits of ''An Unexpected Journey''. {{References}} ==External links== * {{WP|Conan Stevens}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stevens, Conan}} [[Category:Actors and actresses]] [[Category:Australian people]] [[Category:People by name]] [[Category:The Hobbit (film series) cast]] [[fi:Conan Stevens]]
